PDB2SQL Alchemy (deprecated)¶

class pdb2sql.pdb2sqlAlchemy.ATOM(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Base

A simple constructor that allows initialization from kwargs.

Sets attributes on the constructed instance using the names and values in kwargs.

Only keys that are present as attributes of the instance’s class are allowed. These could be, for example, any mapped columns or relationships.

class pdb2sql.pdb2sqlAlchemy.pdb2sql_alchemy(pdbfile, sqlfile=None, fix_chainID=False, verbose=False)[source]¶

Bases: pdb2sql.pdb2sql_base.pdb2sql_base

Use sqlAlchemy to load the database.

get(attribute=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Exectute a simple SQL query that extracts values of attributes for certain condition.

Args :
attribute (str)attribute to retreive eg[‘x’,’y,’z’], ‘xyz’, ‘resSeq’

if None all the attributes are returned

kwargs : argument to select atoms eg : name = [‘CA’,’O’], chainID = ‘A’, no_name = [‘H’]

Returns

data – array containing the value of the attributes

Example : >>> db.get(‘x,y,z’,chainID=’A’,no_name=[‘H’]”)

update(attribute, values, **kwargs)[source]¶

Update the database.

Parameters

  • attribute (str) – string of attribute names eg. [‘x’,’y,’z’], ‘xyz’, ‘resSeq’

  • values (np.ndarray) – an array of values that corresponds to the number of attributes and atoms selected

  • kwargs – selection arguments eg : name = [‘CA’,’O’], chainID = ‘A’, no_name = [‘H’]
